results.description:
This year I’m starting something a little new. Mindful eating is about eating with awareness. Awareness helps people to have a better sense of when they are hungry and when they are full, when they overeat, what cues them to overeat, and what types of situations or environmental factors make overeating more likely to happen. Mindfully eating is typically thought of as slowing down, tasting one’s food, pacing oneself and being able to appreciate food more. However, this is simply is not enough instruction for people who want more of a conscious approach to changing unhelpful eating habits. 

Recently I found the book Eating the Moment by Pavel Somov, Ph.D. This book offers 141 exercises to eat mindfully. They are clever, helpful, and experiential options to increase one’s awareness of eating. The mindful eating groups that I will be co-hosting will be based on these 141 exercises. My goal is to get through the entire book, but to find people who are interested in doing it with me. If you are interested in this journey, you must get the book. Every time we meet for dinner there will be 2-3 exercises to try during the week, and we will report on how they went for each of us. For this first MeetUp group you can just show up and I will have a copy of the book, and if you want to look through it and discuss you can. For upcoming MeetUps, if you want to join, you would have to get the book. 

The Mindful Eating Meetups will be cohosted with other meetup groups, and will include locations on the North Shore as well as in and around Boston. We will try to meet consistently two Thursdays a month as well as 1-2 weekends a month. This event is being cross posted with Cambridge Ethnic Dining MeetUp and MAY INCLUDE MEN. 

In addition, here is an exercise that I would like participants to consider, in the overarching theme of awareness of ethnic diversity and food:

1)  Research the country of the ethnic food MeetUp group and make a list of current facts about the country. Consider facts that you find interesting or fascinating and share your facts with the group.

2)  Find a food or spice that the restaurant uses in its dishes and research any health benefits, uses for the food, or other interesting facts about the food. Introduce the food to the group. Share the unique aspects of this food/ spice and/ or recipe with the group. 

As always, I will document people who NO SHOW as a NO SHOW and move towards not letting you attend future events. So if you make a commitment, come.  End of story.

results.description:
The winner of the highest award at the 2015 Berlin Film Festival, this is the third film that Jafar Panahi (The White Balloon, Offside) has made in defiance of a 20-year ban on filmmaking imposed on him by the Iranian government in 2010. We join the affable director as he crisscrosses Tehran behind the wheel of a taxi, giving rides to a variety of its denizens, ranging from a pirated DVD dealer, to two old women transporting a goldfish to a religious shrine, to his own charmingly chatty young niece, to the human rights lawyer who worked with him when he was in prison. While the tone of Taxi is lighter than that of his previous films, This is Not a Film and Closed Curtain, it continues Panahi’s project of wittily challenging the notion of banning cinema in a time when everyone carries a camera. (MFA description)

From Anthony Lane’s review in The New Yorker: “All this could have yielded something clammy and cloistered, just as Panahi’s status as a martyr for his art could have gulled him into loftiness and pride; and yet, by some miracle, “Taxi” stays as modest as his smile, the point being not to recruit us to his cause but to put us on the side of his compatriots. The mocking of oppression may be steely, but the film’s an easy ride.” (And here is a review by Lane’s New Yorker colleague, Richard Brody.)

Dir.: Jafar Panahi (Iran, 2015, 82 min.) In Persian with English subtitles.


You may want to buy your ticket in advance online. Note that you do not have to pay for museum admission if you're just coming for the film.


We'll meet in the museum just outside of the Remis Auditorium (there is a cafe/wine bar nearby as well as the entrance to the bookstore and gift shop). We'll meet in the same spot after the film, and for those who want to, we'll walk (or take a taxi) to get a drink or meal.
results.name: Acclaimed Iranian Film: Taxi

results.description:
The Second Paradox of Dualism

How do our thoughts cause physical movement?

This question will be the focus of our meeting.

It is a fact that we all act as if there were two worlds – the mental world and the physical world. In addition to the outer physical world, there is also the private, inner world of our conscious experiences and thoughts. In the philosophy of mind, the separation of the world into two radically different kinds of things is called dualism [ref 1].

The paradox of dualism is this: We seem to hold contradictory views about how the two worlds interact. In our practical everyday world, we talk as if the mental world and physical world causally interact. However, we know that something mental (non-physical) cannot causally interact with something physical. It would violate the laws of physics [refs 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6].

How do these two worlds interact? (1) How does the physical world affect the mental world? For example, when you look at a flower, how can your brain create your perception of the flower? How does it create your awareness of that perception? Now consider the opposite direction. (2) How does the mental world affect the physical world? For example, how can your decision to raise your arm cause your arm to go up? 

Our meeting will focus on question (2), the second half of the paradox of dualism. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
References:

[ref 1] “Interactionist”, Encyclopedia Britannica
http://www.britannica.com/topic/interactionism

[ref 2] “Dualist view of mental causation”
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dualism_(philosophy_of_mind)#Dualist_views_of_mental_causation

[ref 3] “Problems of Interaction”, Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy, Scott Calef, http://www.iep.utm.edu/dualism/#SH7c

[ref 4] “Varieties of Dualism: Interaction”, Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy, Howard Robinson, http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/dualism/#VarDuaInt

[ref 5] “Is energy always conserved, even in the case of the expanding universe?”, lara Moskowitz , Scientific American, August 5, 2014,
http://www.scientificamerican.com/article/energy-can-neither-be-created-nor-destroyed/

[ref 6] “Giving Dualism It’s Due”, Australasian Journal of Philosophy,[masked] (2009), William G. Lycan,
http://www.unc.edu/~ujanel/GIVING%20DUALISM%20ITS%20DUE.pdf

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Donations:

To help support the Democracy Center, a voluntary donation, of a few dollars, will be requested at the meeting.
results.name: The Second Paradox of Dualism

Come join us (and other groups) for a free screening of Forks Over Knives, instead of Plant Pure Nation--originally scheduled--which will be shown in February.  Trailer:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O7ijukNzlUg


     You are not doomed to be overweight or unhealthy, and this movie will help show you not only why, but what you can do about it--and much more.

     This is a change from the movie originally scheduled that night, and please note also the time shift to 6:45.

    See  you there!

Al
results.name: Let's see a movie--change in Friday's event!

group.name: Curb Those Cravings!  Healthy Eating = Healthy Weight Loss!

results.description:
The </a><a href="http://www.meetup.com/BostonVolunteer/">Boston Volunteers are a 501c3 nonprofit! 

Once in a while the Boston Volunteers have a social event. 

The purpose is to bring people together and inspire people to get more involved. 

It's a hassle-free opportunity for you to meet new people who share your values. 

For this event we will need 3-4 people to help. 

Can you help: 

1. Setting up/ breaking down

2. Greeting people and making sure everybody feels welcome

3. Collecting donations

Help the Boston Volunteers. Only 4 spots. Get in FREE!

We're expecting more than 125 young professionals. 

Learn more: http://www.meetup.com/Social-Boston-20s-30s/events/22?

Can you help? 

Thank you in advance, :) 
Josh and friends

P.S. Can you please post on the wall which are your top two choices to help with? 

P.P.S. A couple other groups will be joining us. 

Do you like to do good too: Boston Volunteers

Do you live near Brookline: Brookline Area 20's & 30's Adventurers 

Are you a Foodie: Favorite Boston Restaurants

results.description:
Mary Sacksteder of JP started a Plant Pure Nation Pod in JP, which gets together on the 2nd and 4th Friday of the month at Spontaneous Celebration in JP. 

In January, she will show two recent vegan videos food and health.

* January 8: "Forks Over Knives" 
* January 22: "Forks Over Knives" 

In February she will show "PlantPure Nation" with Dr. T. Colin Campbell (Cornell University, Nutrition) and Campbell's son and daughter-in-law and a team of legislators and public officials and social leaders who found that plant-based diets are what this nation needs. 

This is opportunity for each of you to watch each of these videos for free. 
Recently, viewers of PlantPure Nation were charged $20 to see the video.
results.name: JP PlantPure Nation Pod: "Forks Over Knives"

results.description:
Pairs of dancers form a circle, with dance moves called out by one person, a caller (or "líder" or "cantante" in Spanish). Many moves have hand signs to complement the calls; these are useful in noisy venues, where spoken calls might not be easily heard. Most moves involve the swapping of partners, where the partners move around the circle to the next partner. The combination of elaborate dance combinations and constant movement of partners creates a visually spectacular effect.

$50 for 8 classes
Drop-ins welcome: $15
results.name: Rueda de Casino classes - all levels

results.description:
Hey fellow Boston Adventurers, 


Do you want to meet new people who share your values? 
Don't you want easily meet interesting new people? 
What's our celebration going to be like (see pictures) 

Join us for our popular Mix & Mingle celebration. The purpose of this Meetup is for you to easily new people. Discover new communities. 
Discover who else is coming. 

Space is very limited b/c the room is small. This event will fill up very soon. We'll get lots of the regulars and lots of new members. 

A couple other groups will be joining us including: 

Do you live near Brookline: Brookline Area 20's & 30's Adventurers 

Are You a Foodie: Favorite Boston Restaurants

Don't you like hands-on volunteering: Boston Volunteers

We will be providing lots and lots of food for you. We will serve the food at close to 7:30, so don't miss it! 



Please bring a 10 bill with you to help cover our costs for the event, Meetup costs, and to provide more volunteer events for you in the future. Please bring a 10. There will be a long line, and we want to keep it moving fast. 

Oh, and by the way, we'll also be providing a drink ticket (good until 8:30) for you. Good for one refreshing and ice-cold spirit to quench your thirst. Complimentary! :) 


What a Hassle-free way to meet new people who share your values. 

We hope you can join us, :) 
Josh and friends

P.S. The Boston Volunteers strongly supports public transport to get to all our events. Especially for this event b/c parking is very challenging near Faneuil Hall.

What are our favorite ways to get to Sissy's. 

1. What's the popular and reliable Boston bus that everybody's using: Bridj. Bridj stops right next to Sissy's. 

Learn more Bridj.

2. Easily bike here with Hubway

Learn more: Hubway

3. Need a car? My favorite is renting a Prius with ZipCar

Learn more: ZipCar

The Boston Volunteers

Big enough to deliver, small enough to care

Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org

results.description:
The group on Friday voted for the January vegan dinner meetup to be on Friday, January 22 at Walnut Grille, 7:00 pm.

Always check out
http://www.meetup.com/Boston-Vegetarian-Meetup/
for the details.

This monthly dining-out social event is cross-listed with the monthly 'dining out' meetups of:

• the Boston Vegetarian Meetup (some may not even be vegetarians)

• the Boston Vegan Meetup


• the Boston Abolitionist Vegan Meetup (harming animals for food or anything else is REALLY wrong! whatever anyone says about personal choice - and it needs to stop NOW)!!

If you're a member of more than one group, there's more company, but not everyone is on the same place of the same page.  The event organizers will check redundant meetups and adjust their expectations.  At least sign up in this one.

If you need to change your mind and not attend, PLEASE be sure to adjust your response(s) on Meetup.com.
results.name: Dine out with Vegetarians (Vegan Food Available)

results.description:
We will laugh over 12 different ways, using over 12 different muscles groups. There is a laughter zone that allows us to be part of the experience. Laughter leads us to a skill that will transform your life for the better.

We also do traditional walking and laughing exercises.  Two new ones (Belly Dancing and Incredible Hulk laughter)  will give you such a work out that we include "Micro Movements" to help you recover.

We will take a happiness break by learning how to feel happy sensations created by the body. Mixing in Mind/Body awareness we will use interactive mindfulness to change our perceptions of ourselves as well as others.

This is for all ages.

$5 per person to cover expenses.

$5 per family. You have your whole life ahead of you. Don't you want to spend it knowing how to tap into desirable body sensations

We Have 3 co-leaders in our laughter club.  Walter Ness, Anya Weber and Jon Hindmarsh.
results.how_to_find_us: SomervilleLaughterClub.com
results.name: Let's get together and Laugh together

results.description:
It's my first Meetup group creation so I'm not sure on how to do that.
But I guess let's gather around a drink and just get to know each other.
In Madagascar they call it Vendredi magnifique (Magnificent Friday), a time to go out and meet with your friends. So let's have our first Vendredi magnifique! 

I am not sure about the place yet, we can figure it out once we have a better idea of the number of people.
results.name: Let's have our first Meetup and get to know each other.

results.description:
Menu


Stuffed - Lamb sausage, chives, truffle sauce

Smoked - Curry Creme Fraiche, thyme

Sauted- Linguini, soft egg, carmlized onions, VT Cheddar

Grilled- Crostini, kale, Herb Better, Lemon

3- ways - Duck breast, risotto, shroom sauce, shroom salt, brussel sprouts

Toasted - Sage and Mushroom Ice cream, meringue , Chamomile Honey

Join us Friday January 22rd for a 5-course meal featuring mushrooms from our friends at Mycoterra. . Dinner will be at 7:00pm in Boston, MA. Tickets are $60, we will offer both a meat and vegetarian options. Beverages will be BYOB.

Email me at [masked] or purchase your seat in advance here: http://www.tbdfoods.com/dine-with-us/fun-guy-dinner-1-22 to confirm your seat and I will send the address

The menu is still TBD for the moment but we will have that up soon, we will feature mushrooms in each course and prepare them in a number of ways. From risotto and broth to saute and fried, expect the dinner to be filled with those fungi’s we all enjoy so much. Have a suggestion, feel free to email us to let us know what you would like to see on the menu.

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

7:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

7:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

7:20 - Play!!!!!!

9:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!
results.how_to_find_us: The field is right next to Alewife station on the Red Line. There is also plenty of parking provided no one else is using the field. (Not an issue in the winter.)
results.name: Friday Night Time Ultimate @ Russell Field

results.description:
Please join us to watch and discuss the second episode of BELIEF, a groundbreaking 7-part documentary series that aired on the OWN network in October.

BELIEF is an exploration of the power of our diverse belief systems, faith practices and cultural traditions that connect us to ourselves, sustain us through the most challenging times and bind us closer together in community with one another. Oprah has described this series as the very reason she founded a television network - to be able to share stories that connect people together.

This series highlights stories of people from around the world, diverse in their beliefs, but united by a deep desire to find purpose and meaning in their lives. It journeys to the far reaches of the world, illuminating sacred places and practices that will engage believers of any faith or none at all.

Our goal is that engaging in these questions and conversations together draws us to a place of deepened intercultural understanding and greater healing. Our hope is that this series can act as a catalyst to start and/or deepen intercultural and interfaith communication, trust building and partnership.

The gathering is free of charge. A facilitated discussion will follow the episode, inviting you to explore the beliefs and practices that bring meaning to your own life.

For more information about the series, or to watch the 2-minute trailer, visit http://beliefteam.com/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be right in the sanctuary...come in through the large glass doors in the front of the spiritual center on 13 Common Street in Natick Center across from the town green.
results.name: Community Watch Party: What Do You Believe?

results.description:
Hey fellow Social Fun members, 


Do you want to meet new people who share your values? 
Do you want easily meet interesting new people? 
What's our celebration going to be like (see pictures) 

Join us for our popular Mix & Mingle celebration. The purpose of this Meetup is for you to meet people who are different from you. Discover new communities. 
Discover who else is coming. 

For this event we will be joining one of Boston's most popular nonprofits. 
Learn more:  Boston Volunteers

Space is very limited b/c the room is small. This event will fill up very soon. We'll get lots of the regulars and lots of new members. 

A couple other groups will be joining us including: 

Don't you like to do good: Boston Volunteers

Do you live in the Brookline area: Brookline Area 20's & 30's Adventurers 

Are you a Foodie: Favorite Boston Restaurants

We will be providing lots and lots of food for you. We will serve the food at close to 7:30, so don't miss it!   

Please bring a 10 bill with you to help cover our costs for the event, Meetup costs, and to provide more volunteer events for you in the future. Please bring a 10. There will be a long line, and we want to keep it moving fast. 

Oh, and by the way, we'll also be providing a drink ticket (good until 8:30) for you. Good for one refreshing and ice-cold spirit to quench your thirst. Complimentary! :) 

What a Hassle-free way to meet new people who share your values. 

JWe hope you can join us, :) 
Josh and friends

P.S. How to get to Sissy K's: The Boston Volunteers strongly supports public transport to get to all our events. Especially for this event b/c parking is very challenging near Faneuil Hall.

What are our favorite ways to get to Sissy's. 

1. What's the popular and reliable Boston bus that everybody's using: Bridj. Bridj stops right next to Sissy's. 

Learn more Bridj.

2. Easily bike here with Hubway

Learn more: Hubway

3. Need a car? My favorite is renting a Prius with ZipCar

Learn more: ZipCar

results.description:
JUST IN: We will all be sharing special magnetized water to promote harmony, health and happiness! This water has spent time in a magnetite chamber which has created a powerful localized magnetic field in the water that rejuvenates our cell structure and improves the function of metabolic processes. Because magnetized water is wetter and therefore more penetrating, it furthers better assimilation of the various nutrients and vitamins in the cells. The Soviet biologist Kumarov had experimentally doubled the life span of flies by feeding them magnetized sugar.  (http://www.life-sources.com/pages/The-Health-Benefits-of-Magnetic-Water.html)


We celebrate the sign of Aquarius as we move into the eleventh house at this time. The Water bearer is the sign of friendships. "The Eleventh House speaks to destiny -- in simple terms, our hopes and dreams, what we desire and what we want to achieve. Our creative vision is highlighted, the simple act of working toward our maximal selves. The power of collective creation, as well as the creative sparks generated by the group, are also important to this house. By banding together, we can create so much more."


Water is the true symbol of purification. As Jesus said, "All men must be washed, symbolic of the cleansing of the soul.  This healing brings the cleansing to our mind ever moment. Therefore, "the key message of January is don’t divide life into spiritual and mundane, special and ordinary. It’s all special and all mundane. Everything we do has power. Every word, action, thought, feeling and intention carries weight in this universe. If we deem the everyday world of work, commuting, shopping, cleaning, earning enough to keep ourselves afloat, as somehow less worthy than when we’re ‘being spiritual’ we deny the presence of the sacred at the heart of our life."

So if you come to the Buddhist Temple for a sound healing, what can you expect? 


When you come in, you take your shoes off, then you walk to the Dharma Hall which will be on your immediate right at the top of the stairs. We'll start with a short introduction and discuss each of our intentions for how we want to work with the sound and then meditate for a few minutes to tune into each of our specific intentions. The general theme will be new years resolutions - specifically bringing in the vibrations we need! Then, everyone will sit or lie down on super comfy pillow mats (bring your own blanket) and we'll begin our journey into sound.

I start by playing the 500 pound cast-iron temple bell and then I move into the sweet sounds of my Tibetan singing bowls. What follows, I can't exactly say, as the sound decides what it wants to say. But you can expect to hear the rainbow voice, the sound of the overtone chant singing with the tibetan bowls. You won't be able to tell which is which but this is all part of the dance. You will even feel what it's like to have the bowls played on you as the sound moves your energy where it needs to go. Tingshas, tuning forks, rattles and more are all part of the play as the sound moves you to rest at your destination without ever having moved. So, please, come and feel something unique. You never leave anywhere exactly the same, but when it comes to sound healing, you will leave sounding more like yourself :)

Please bring a blanket to enhance the comfort of your experience! Offerings are freely accepted :)


love and light,


Brian Russo

(781)[masked]

[masked]
results.name: Water Bearer Sound Healing

results.description:
Each and every Friday, we're proud to open the doors of our music school in Central Square for a FREE seminar, demo or meet-up. Hell, we’ll even throw a classical music concert or two. What's in store this week? Let's find out:

Schuyler Stevens will be giving a walk through of hardware & software used in most DJ setups. From the grooves in the record right down to the electronics found inside your average mixer, Serato box, etc. You will gain a fundamental understanding of how each piece of equipment you will be using works for DJ’ing and scratching.

Schuyler Stevens started out in Burlington Vermont learning how to DJ and make music when he was 15. He got his own pair of turntables and inherited a small portion of his parents record collection and was off at light speed, challenging himself and pushing his own limits ever since. Schuyler moved to Boston and attended The New England Institute of Art when he was 18 to continue his pursuit for more knowledge. Since going to school, Stevens has been gigging as a DJ/turntablist in the local Boston scene as well as in Brooklyn, NY. He has also been tracking and producing songs for multiple MC’s around Boston. His music draws inspiration from old records, and mixes sounds of vintage samples with modern day synthesis, recording, and processing techniques.

Schuyler believes that you can never stop learning, there will always be somebody who can show you something you never thought was possible, and in turn inspire you to push your own boundaries beyond what you imagined you could do. It is an ongoing loop perpetuated by people of like minds all striving for the same musical bliss, but in their own unique ways. In the world of music, anything and everything is possible.
results.name: Inside the DJ Set-Up [1/22] #FREE

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and shared energy. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in Boston?

At TurnON, we play three communication games (just talking, no touching), and you can participate at whatever level feels good to you. Imagine meeting new people in an environment where they feel comfortable to be themselves; a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation. That's what we have created.

TurnON events give you the opportunity to look deeper into yourself, through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses. What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to be authentic. It's like a giant exhale when the rest of the world is asking you to hold it in. In just an hour, you may even forget that you are in Boston.

TurnON Boston is an organization that teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON events are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without actually doing the practice. At the end of the evening, we will give you a brief description of the practice of OM and information on how to learn more.

$10, payable at the door.

Please arrive on time - we lock the door promptly at 7:40

Limited non-resident parking is available alongside our building on Dudley Street, or plentiful metered spaces on Mass Ave are only one block away (and free after 6pm). We are a 10-minute walk from the Red Line at Davis Square.

Print this parking pass to park in resident spaces: turnonboston.com/parking/[masked]-22.pdf


Curious about what Orgasmic Meditation is about? More info here:
http://tedxtalks.ted.com/video/TEDxSF-Nicole-Daedone-Orgasm-Th
results.name: TurnON Boston

results.description:
Ready to take this practice to the next level?  Spiritually, sensually, intimately?  Looking to spend more time going deeper with each partner you encounter?  Want to learn more about Tantra and take it into your life in a  more profound way so it impacts your life and not just "in workshop?"  Are you willing to stop saying "in my real life...." and come to experience complete integration of body/mind, self and One, spirituality and sexuality?  


The Intimate Puja Circle - Advanced Practice - will offer an opportunity to go deeper into the practice and with your community, if you choose to.  The first half of the evening will be shorter as well, leaving more room for connection during the Puja Circles in the second half of the night!  

Ever wish you had more time???  You asked for it and here it is!  :)  Please keep reading for more important details..... 

______________________________

If you have not worked with me (Robyn) before but have done other workshops on Tantra, relationship and intimacy - there is a short phone interview required so that we can assess whether the Advanced Practice Intimate Puja Circle is best for you.  Please email me privately [masked] so that we can set up a time to talk. 


_______________________________

This Intimate Puja Circle is for those who have been practicing with me for 3 months or longer.  This is event is for intermediate and advanced practitioners and students.


_______________________________

Even if you've been before, please read the description below in full before RSVPing to this event.   Thank you!   

_______________________________

Please note that this event runs for 3 hours and will be offered on Friday and/or Saturday nights depending on the month 


_______________________________

A Puja, in Sanskrit, means reverence, honor, worship and adoration.  It's used by the Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, and others -- as a ceremony to honor a very special occasion; it's also used more often as part of a sacred ritual - a practice to support opening to the wisdom of the Divine -- your Source. 

Intimate Puja Circle - Advanced Practice, will be a place to: 

• Share a deeper and sacred connection with the Intimate Puja community

• Learn and practice Tantra, yoga, meditation and other tools and techniques for expansion, awakening and living a joyful, peaceful, abundant life 

• Practice authentic relating with one another; take risks, make choices, honor your boundaries 

• Experience deep connections with those interested in sacred sexuality, energy, expanded orgasm, conscious relationship, spirituality  - people like YOU!

Tantra For Everyone:  

This special evening will begin with many invitations to connect with each other in light and playful ways -- always with the opportunity to go as deep as you choose.  Single or coupled, you'll experience Tantra as a way to say 'hello', get to know one another, mingle and connect.

The Advanced Practice Intimate Puja Circle will offer an opportunity to go deeper if you choose to.  And the first half of the evening will be shorter, leaving more room for connection during the Puja Circles in the second half of the night!  

Here's what Participants are saying!

"This is a very special event; a non-threatening, yet deep and authentic way to meet others. I've been online dating for years and it's just not for me.  I've met some really special people at your events."

"Saved my marriage, literally."  

"Congratulations and thank you for a wonderful evening.  Reflecting on it today, I am just amazed at the intimacy I experienced with virtually no history and the joy I received."

"Very different from my normal way of life, you did create on a small scale  and it was exactly what I was hoping for....the experience of deeper intimacy."

"It's so amazing to walk into a room of "strangers" and walk out feeling in love with everyone!"

"I didn't think I'd be able to connect with anyone there.  I was so surprised, and delighted, how easy it was to enjoy myself with every man in that room! Thank you Robyn, for your excellent facilitation skills. I felt totally safe!"

"We have to wait a whole month until the next one????"

"We love to come as a couple and meet others on a similar path."


The Intimate Puja Circle</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=SHVW639WM28LC"><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ZES8HVDSP97PA"></a> itself will begin part-way through the night during which you'll have the chance to connect more deeply with others (one-on-one) -- this part of the evening will be facilitated, with a structure offered, however, you will have ample time to co-create with the beloved in front of you!!  You will be at choice and encouraged to ask for 100% of what you want.


Deepen With Your Community:

Once the formal part of the evening is over, there'll be time to dance, hang out, cuddle, snuggle, relax, process, and rest.  There will always be chocolate! 

The Intimate Puja Circle community is growing and growing!  There are hundreds of men, women and couples who have been participating for the past 2 1/2 years.  About 50 - 75% of the monthly gatherings are "regulars" -- spiritual-minded beings who are committed to coming back to love with themselves, God and each other. People's whose lives have changed significantly because of this practice.  

"I have been on a wonderful journey of “Coming back to Love” of self, my children and those that come in my path each day. “Coming back to Mitchell” is synonymous with where I am and how much grateful I am for allowing myself the ability to re-open my heart and soul to those that wish to receive my Shiva and Shakti within me. Instrumental in my shift comes from meeting and integrating the practices of Robyn Vogel, psychotherapist, Intimacy and Sex Coach, and facilitator of “middle-path” Tantra, teaching me Tantra and how being present allows the miracle of conscious living."  -- Mitchell Rosenwald / Realtor

Questions You May Have:

Please email me to set up a time to talk if you are unsure whether this Advanced Practice Intimate Puja is for you or not.  [masked]
results.name: SOLD OUT Intimate Puja Circle -  Advanced Practice

The games we play at TurnON events are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without actually doing the practice. At the end of the evening, we will give you a brief description of the practice of OM and information on how to learn more.

>>>FREE ADMISSION for Cambridge and Boston Singles Meetup members, but you MUST tell us at the door that you found us on CBSM to get in for free, so don't forget where you found us!<<<

Please arrive on time - we lock the door promptly at 7:40

Limited non-resident parking is available alongside our building on Dudley Street, or plentiful metered spaces on Mass Ave are only one block away (and free after 6pm). We are a 10-minute walk from the Red Line at Davis Square.

results.description:
Eclectic (and fabulous) Singer/Songwriter Kali Stoddard-Imari returns to West Medford Square. Kali performed at the Halloween Block Party and several other Medford events this past year!

For samples of his music and more about Kali: http://www.projectkali.com/

Biography: Kali grew up in the North East Kindom of Vermont playing around with poetry, hip hop and chorus until he picked up the guitar at 17. His attention was always rooted in music, but the guitar gave him insight and opened his eyes and ears to a new world of musical creation. His passion grew as he fused his musical past with Americana, Island and Folk, stripping him of a particular genre and transforming him into an eclectic singer songwriter.
In 2010, he moved with his family out of Vermont and into Boston in search of more people to spread music too. He is now based in the Boston area where he lives with his wife Jennifer, and his children Nia, Asha, and Sekou. His family and the necessity of positive experiences inspire him to create music for the people. “I strive to create more than Feel Good Music, I create Get Good Music. Music is medicine for the masses. When we come together, we treat the ailments in our society and communities. This is something I cannot ignore, nor should anyone else.”


He moves all throughout New England and New York, playing community events and festivals and opening up for acts like Adam Ezra Group (2013 New England Music Awards-“Band of the Year”), Taj Mahal and the Taj Mahal Trio (Grammy Award winning blues legend), and Martin Sexton (one of the most talked-about arrivals on the “new folk” acoustic music scene and hard working do it yourself artist). His debut self-titled album “KALI” came out in Nov of 2014.


Sanctuary hosts a monthly Music for the Soul Coffeehouse.  It almost always falls on the fourth Friday!


This is a BYOB (wine and beer) and we will provide the coffee.

Sanctuary UCC also offers and monthly faith and film screening and discussion, a monthly installation of the visual arts and occasional spoken word events.


To get on the mailing list for Sanctuary's "Arts and Inspiration" Series which includes Music for the Soul, Faith and Film, The Gallery (visual arts) and spoken word events - send an email to [masked].

www.sanctuaryucc.org

The fabulous, fun-filled event begins with a class from 8:00 to 9:30 and continues with dj'd dancing until  11pm music provided by some extraordinary DJs.  

Class 8-9:15 Blue Tango — Hsueh-tze Lee -Argentine Tango has been enthralling dancers for over 100 years, and is surging worldwide among dancers of all ages. In social tango, dancers improvise musically within a close embrace. Tango is creative, dynamic, challenging, fun, expressive and transcendent. Come singly or with a partner to discover the special connection that is tango. Hsueh-tze Lee teaches tango across the United States and internationally.9:15 -11:30 Stay and dance  to music provided by Robin and Rose


Dancers of all ages and abilities are invited to dance barefoot, any way you like, with or without a partner, in a smoke and alcohol free environment. Children are welcome.

Dance Friday is an activity of the non-profit Movement Collective. Suggested Donation: $15 8pm-9:15, $10-15 after 9:30, $5-10 after 11,  under  23 years old $5-15, or donate 45 minutes of your time to help out.  We recommend casual, light-weight, comfortable clothing that you can  move in.

PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU PURCHASE YOUR TICKETS.

Let's get together and watch some horror THIS Friday!

Movies times are out! Looks like The Boy isn't playing in ALL theaters, so we had to change the location. Time is exact now.

The Movie:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XGbB9UQ6r1g


A young American named Greta (Lauren Cohan) takes a job as a nanny for an 8-year-old boy in a remote English village. To her surprise, Greta learns that the child of her new employers is a life-size doll. They care for the doll as if it was human, which helps the couple to cope with the death of their own son 20 years earlier. When Greta violates a list of strict rules, a series of disturbing and inexplicable events bring her worst fears to life, leading her to believe that the doll is alive.

Come visit the Makusue Ski House, cheer on the Makusue Ski team, and enjoy our slope-side hot cocoa!


The race team is looking for your support, or just to share the great Makusue house with you this weekend. Grab a friend and head to the great white north!

You can even race for free as a first timer to see if you like it!

Bring your bedding & toiletries, bring your best attitude.

The two night stay at Makusue's is $50 ($25 per night). CASH ONLY Apres Events are $24

results.description:
ImprovBoston Mainstage cast member Matthew Bistany is writing a new comedic murder mystery every week; to find out who did it, he’ll need the audience to guide him and his cast of talented improvisers through the laugh-filled “writing process.”

Watch as the master of suspense brings his next stories to life before your very eyes! Each week, Matt and this cast of Boston improv veterans create a new murder mystery novel, complete with audience-inspired rewrites, misdirections and hijinx. How will these literary masterpieces end? Not even Bistany knows.

This week, our story is set in a 1960's-esque retro future. Robots! Martians! Lots of shiny material! It's the last show of the run, some come see what critics have called "the best one" before it's too late.

Bistany’s Mysteries runs Fridays at 10PM, January 8 - 22. Tickets are $18, $14 students at the door and available online at:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/bistanys-mysteries-tickets-19602501610

results.description:
We will run down Comm Ave in the carriage lane to the Chestnut Hill/BC reservoir, with the option to run around the reservoir before turning around. This is an out and back course so the distance is flexible - you can run however many miles you want!  There are some hills - we will run 3 of the 4 Newton Hills along the Boston Marathon course (if you go at least 8 miles - 4 out and 4 back).

Meet outside at the tables next to Bruegger's and the ATM.  We will leave right at 8:30 AM (especially when it is cold out!).

The pace will vary depending on who shows up.  If there is a wide range of paces, we frequently end up splitting into smaller groups based on pace.  Even if your pace doesn't "match up" with anyone else, meeting up with the group and starting the run with everyone is a great way to get yourself out of bed on those early Saturday mornings!
results.name: Comm Ave long run  8-15+ miles

results.description:
Join us for our weekly weekend run! We'll be meeting in Back Bay and logging some miles around Boston. All paces and runner levels are welcome! 

During the winter months, we'll be meeting at the Boston Marathon RunBase on Boylston street for our Saturday runs. They have lockers and showers available for your use though you'll need to provide your own lock if you plan to use a locker. 

Please post your desired pace and distance when you RSVP.

We have two routes for this weekend, a 4 mile route and an 11 mile route. Both routes take the Mass. Ave bridge into Cambridge through MIT. The 4 mile route turns onto Brookline Ave and takes the BU Bridge back into Boston. 

The 11  mile route continues through Central Square and over the Western Ave Bridge to Allston before continuing to the Chestnut Hill Reservoir. The route finishes by following Beacon Street to Back Bay. 

4 Mile Route

11 Mile Route
results.name: Whippets Weekend Run

group.name: Dashing Whippets Running Team - Boston Chapter

results.description:
Would you like to speed up your application, but don't know how? Let's get a group of experts together in one room and solve that problem!

A variety of options exist for using NVIDIA GPUs to accelerate applications. Microway will provide access to their Test Drive cluster with Tesla K40 and K80 GPUs. The software tools will include all available NVIDIA GPU libraries, ArrayFire and the PGI compilers with OpenACC support.

Attendees should bring a laptop, which will be used to access the GPU-accelerated systems. You should also think about bringing in a piece of code that you'd like to speed up.

Sponsors of this event which we'd like to thank:

• MIT is providing the meeting space

• Microway is providing access to their compute resources, light breakfast, coffee, and lunch

• NVIDIA will be providing tokens for their online GPU computing courses
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the 3rd floor of this building: https://whereis.mit.edu/?q=e-51
results.name: GPU-acceleration Hackathon

group.name: HPC & GPU Supercomputing Group of Boston

results.description: Come check out dragon boating with Living Root! We're a co-ed dragon boat team and we're always looking for new paddlers to join us. This is a great way to get in shape, stay in shape, meet people, and do something fun and competitive. How to get there: We practice at the pool at the JFK Elementary School in Somerville. Walk through the outdoor basketball courts to the rear of the building to find the pool entrance. Take the stairs down to the ground floor and head through the locker rooms to get to the pool. Practice will begin poolside at 9 am. Wear athletic clothing. Although we won't do any swimming, you will get somewhat wet. Parking is free in the school parking lot. The T station at Porter Square is a 5 minute walk away. Practice will last an hour and 30 minutes. We provide paddles and all the necessary equipment--just bring yourself! No paddling experience is required. We have an excellent coaching staff who will teach you everything you will need to know. We often head out for a quick bite to eat after practice, and you're welcome to join us. Send questions to: Dave Parker at [masked] [url=http://www.livingroot.org/]www.livingroot.org[/url]
results.how_to_find_us: We meet by the pool.
results.name: Indoor Paddling Session

results.description:
Their major issue is that they have tons of donations, and not even close enough amount of volunteers, to sort useable vs. recycle goods.  

http://thewishproject.org/ 

The Wish Project is a non-profit dedicated to providing free furniture, home goods, baby goods, and clothing to people in need in the Merrimack Valley, primarily through reuse and recycling. They serve thousands of people each year, and rely on the help of many volunteers. Let's be some of those volunteers! We'll take on whatever task they need on this day, but generally it involves sorting and organizing donations so they can be given out to clients. Children ages 8+ are welcome to join the effort. It's a great opportunity to teach your kids compassion in a very hands-on way. 

IMPORTANT:

If you are bringing children, please make a note in the comments section so I can give the Wish Project an accurate count of adults and kids who will be attending.

http://thewishproject.org/

 *PLEASE NOTE:  When you RSVP 'yes' it becomes a commitment. I am in contact with the volunteer coordinator, Patty, whom is now a member, giving her a head count. She then creates a list of things that need to be done -relying upon the number of volunteers. If your plans change, please be considerate -take a moment to update your RSVP to 'no.' It's very simple- and greatly appreciated! Thanks :)

results.description:
Join the Waltham Land Trust for their annual Duck Walk along the Charles River.

Bring your binoculars, cheat sheet from the Warm Up, and check out the wintering waterfowl on our annual walk.

Birds from Canada visit our "warmer" climate in winter, and they love the Charles River. We'll walk along the path next to the river and stop at viewing platforms on our way to Moody Street and back, crossing over the new boardwalk along the Charles River Museum of Industry. Last year we saw two bald eagles before leaving the parking lot! Hooded and common mergansers, ring neck ducks, golden eyes, and all sorts of beautiful avian creatures grace the Charles' icy waters.  Download and bring this sheet of common birds of the Charles River to help with identification. Dress warmly and bring binoculars!
results.name: Duck Walk

results.description:
Fair Foods of Dorchester (FairFoods.org) delivers fresh (rescued) produce to about 50 sites (only some are made public and publicized), and they hope to add MORE sites.

Each site is hosted by a local organization (mostly nonprofits, but some are for-profit residences).

Each site needs unpaid volunteers to help (a) unload the truck(s), (b) set up the tables and produce (in order by weight, from heavy to light), and (c) bag the produce into standard bags, which each sites 'neighbors' will come by (during the 'open' period) and take for $2/bag.

Most sites get freshly-baked bread (baked fresh that morning).

Volunteers get to take home one or two bags for themselves and 1-2 loaves of bread, also - because they volunteered.

To volunteer, in-mail the Meetup event host and say specifically which site and which date and time interests you (so that you can be registered in advance as a volunteer). In that in-mail, please provide your ACTUAL e-mail address, real full name, and phone number.

Please bring lots of extra used but clean and reusable plastic bags for the bagging.


Bring with you some means for transporting your own 'comped' produce home with you.
results.name: Volunteer for $2 Bag of Vegetables - or get a $2 Bag for Yourself

results.description:
We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (circa[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

See you there!

results.description:
(a set of 6 Saturday classes)


Always wanted to learn how they really fought in the middle ages? Forget any ideas about crude battering on armour; the successful warrior strikes to the gaps and the openings of his or her opponent's attacks, and supplements this with disarms, throws, and other techniques which secure the advantage over larger or stronger attackers.

Around the year 1400, Fiore dei Liberi trained medieval knights and squires, and authored multiple books of medieval combat, some of which have survived to the present day. His method, L'Arte d'Armizare (the Art of Bearing Arms), shows an integrated and cross-referenced system of sword, dagger, grappling, spear & lance, pollaxe and other weapons on foot and on horseback, with and without armour, and easily dispels any illusions that medieval combat was about unskilled strength.

Our beginners' course is six linked classes that give the basic techniques and vocabulary of L'Arte, and enables men and women to begin regular unarmoured training and learning.  No prior training needed; all class equipment is provided.

So, come join the scholars and combatants of our company!

(The price shown is for the set of all six classes (Jan 9, 16, 23, 30, Feb 6 and 13) and membership and registration.  Classes are not offered separately.  We'll send an email with some class materials before the first session.)

results.description:
Orgasmic Meditation (OM) is a wellness practice (like yoga and pilates) that is designed for singles and couples to experience more connection, vitality, pleasure, and meaning in every aspect of their lives. 

People OM because they want to feel more connected, more flow, more vitality, more… everything. The practice is simple, specific, and repeatable, focusing on the clit, the female center of power and pleasure. Every OM is set up the same way so participants can get out of their heads, and instead follow their feeling sense, listen to their bodies, and be more present.

We offer, for January 23 and 24 only, a 2 session, 3 hour OM training package for individuals and couples, run as a small group training (maximum 8 students per session).

The first (2-hour) session includes: 
   - The beginning philosophy behind OM 
    - Introduction of a new definition of Orgasm 
       (the difference between Climax and Orgasm) 
    - The benefits of an OM practice 
    - The 5 Laws of Orgasm and how they relate to OM and life 
    - Basic Stroking Technique 
    - Your first OM, guided by your coach*

The second (1 hr) session approximately a week later includes: 
    - Check-in on your practice 
    - A guided OM to deepen your practice

The training includes complimentary OM Badge Membership (access to OM Circles in Boston or anywhere else in the world, and access to the OM Hub, an online social network only for OM practitioners). 

After completing this training, participants become eligible to enroll in OM Practice Club, a weekly class for deepening your practice.


Dates:
Session 1:
    - January 23, 11am or 2pm
    - January 24, 11am or 2pm

Session 2:
    - By appointment. Must be completed by February 7.

Tuition, January 23 and 24 only: $197 
(standard rate for private training is $397)

*One of your first lessons in your intake conversation by phone, is how to find and invite a partner.
results.name: Semi-Private OM Training!

Join us for the January 2016 Meetup! WEATHER UPDATE: OK, folks the Meetup is on! If you RSVP'd "no" yesterday but would still like to come, that's great; see you there. I've moved the start time back to 11:30 a.m. and suspect we'll finish up by 4:30 or 5--but come and leave whenever you like.

ATC THEMES:


1. Make items from goodie bags exchanged at December 2015 Meetup.


2. Artist's Choice (anything goes)


DEMO/ACTIVITY:  TBD.


WHAT OTHER SUPPLIES SHOULD I BRING? There's a suggested list in "All About the NE ATC+ Meetup" (also at the top of the Message Board). But even if you show up empty-handed, that's fine--we have loaner tools.

POTLUCK LUNCH: You're invited, but certainly not required, to bring food or drink for our potluck lunch, or to just bring your own lunch. No need to sign up; bring whatever you like. Please remember that you must take, give away, or throw away any food you bring; we can't leave ANYTHING behind.

FREE STUFF/SALE ITEMS: You're welcome to bring items to give away or sell to other Meetup members onsite. But anything that doesn't get taken or sold needs to go home with you. 

COST: $10, regardless of when you arrive or depart; it covers our costs for the day. Sorry, no partial payments or IOUs. Cash is preferred; small bills are greatly appreciated. You can break large bills in business on Route 135 near the church. If payment is a hardship, please let the organizer know--we can work it out.

RSVPs: Please RSVP "yes" to attend; that way, we'll have an approximate headcount, and you'll receive all notifications about the Meetup! If your plans change, and you will be unable to attend, please change your RSVP to "no" no later than 24 hours before the start of the Meetup, so we'll know not to expect you. Anyone who cancels within 24 hours, regardless of the reason, will need to pay the fee anyway to help cover our costs for the day. 

LAST-MINUTE UPDATES: Please check your email in box and the website before leaving for the Meetup. That way, in the unlikely event that we need to cancel due to bad weather or any other reason, you'll be sure to get the news.

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

This book was second place winner for our last poll.  Please see the information below.

Staring unflinchingly into the abyss of slavery, this spellbinding novel transforms history into a story as powerful as Exodus and as intimate as a lullaby. Sethe, its protagonist, was born a slave and escaped to Ohio, but eighteen years later she is still not free. She has too many memories of Sweet Home, the beautiful farm where so many hideous things happened. And Sethe’s new home is haunted by the ghost of her baby, who died nameless and whose tombstone is engraved with a single word: Beloved. Filled with bitter poetry and suspense as taut as a rope, Beloved is a towering achievement.

Hope to see some of you then.

results.description:
Join us for a monthly meetup to play some 18xx games.

Contact Dave M (click the link, then click "Message") for the address.

For the uninitiated, 18xx games are a subset of train games with a focus on stock-market and tile laying mechanics in the 19th century. Players start-up and manage (or mismanage…) railroads with the winning condition being money in the player’s hands at the end of the game. These games are all long, heavy, and feature little randomness leading many to consider them some of the most rewarding games to play. For more information please visit the wikipedia page at (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/18XX_games) or the BGG Wiki page at (https://boardgamegeek.com/wiki/page/18xx). You can find a version of the rules for 1830 on the mayfair website (http://mayfairgames.com/mfg-shop3/rules/MFG1830-Rules-V1_0.pdf) (focus on the 1830 classic rules) if you are interested in getting a head start.

For this meetup, we will try and get somewhere between 2-3 games in over the session. Players of all skill levels are invited to join us and we are happy to teach new players the system as well as teach new games in the system (I am still fairly new to the system myself).

PLEASE NOTE: Since the focus of this meetup is on longer games and the headcount limit is low (5 players/1 table) please be considerate when RSVPing for this event. Please try to give notice to those on the waitlist if you expect to have to drop your RSVP. Additionally, since there is only one table and the games are long, please try to arrive on time, since 1 person late will delay the whole group.

Please contact Dave M (click the link, then click "Message") for the address as well as any other information.
results.name: Monthly 18xx in Waltham

Laughter Yoga is a body/mind practice for well-being that involves deep breathing and a few stretches, playful laughter exercises (no jokes or comedy), clapping and deep relaxation. It can strengthen the immune system, combat the negative effects of stress, and is a powerful antidote to depression and anxiety. 

Any age and any level of physical ability can participate in this uplifting experience! New laughers are always welcomed! $12 and members of Living Buddha Nature get 20% off. results.description:
**********************************************************************

NOTE: This event may be cancelled and pushed to next week due to weather conditions. Please check back with the event before coming!

**********************************************************************

Hi All!

Let's sketch the Frank Gehry Stata Center at MIT! Built by the controversial Frank Gehry in 2004, it is home to the a few Electrical Engineering and Computer Science labs as well as the Department of Linguistics and Philosophy. 

Frank Gehry is the Pritzker Prize winning architect, who's buildings have become world renowned attractions. Gehry works on the edges of modernism and funk architecture while delving deeply into experimentation. However many of his works have attracted criticism of not being functional buildings. In 2007, MIT sued Gehry for "providing deficient design services and drawings" which caused leaks to spring, masonry to crack, mold to grow, drainage to back up, and falling ice and debris to block emergency exits. The design has been praised by some and decried by others, and is a polarizing building in the architectural world. 

Let's check out this masterpiece and try our skills at drawing modernism architecture. Hope to see you there!

-Miriam

results.description:
Our second Patient Night joining forces with the MPAA will focus on cannabis and its use as a preventative medicine. 

We hope to bring together the entire cannabis community to engage in some social networking and learn about the Massachusetts medical marijuana program and marijuana as a preventative medicine. Refreshments will be provided.

Location of this event is being announced soon so stay tuned.

Featured Speakers 

Nichole Snow

Executive Director of Massachusetts Patient Advocacy Alliance

Talk Title: Safe Access in Massachusetts

Talk Synopsis: Nichole Snow will overview the medical marijuana program in Massachusetts including becoming a patient or caregiver and how to access Registered Marijuana Dispensaries.

Connect with Nichole Snow: https://www.linkedin.com/in/nichole-snow-39988332


Dr. Uma Dhanabalan

Lead Physician at Uplifting Health & Wellness

Talk Title:  Medical Marijuana 101 and for Prevention

Talk Synopsis:  Dr. Uma will discuss how one qualifies to become a patient and caregiver in Massachusetts and how to properly use marijuana as medicine and for prevention of other ailments.

Connect with Dr. Uma:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/uma-dhanabalan-md-mph-faafp-mro-02843040

Nial Chase DeMena

Chairman and CEO at Manna Molecular Science

Talk Title:  Marijuana as a Preventative Medicine

Talk Synopsis:  Nial will cover marijuana as a preventative medicine and how one could use cannabis to prevent a whole host of ailments from onset.  

Connect with Nial:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/nial-chase-demena-76872089

Patient Night is being sponsored by: 

Ermont, Inc.

Ermont is a Quincy based registered marijuana dispensary currently moving through the Department of Public Health registration process and working with the city of Quincy during the renovation and construction phase of the project. We are committed to opening a best-in-class medical marijuana dispensary to provide high-quality laboratory-tested medicine to registered patients. Our projected date of opening is January of 2016. We look forward to serving our patients and our community. Please check back periodically for updates.

http://www.ermontinc.org/


CannaBranders

Cannabranders is a growing team of industry experts with over five decades of combined experience in software development, graphic design, social media marketing, website development, SEO, and much more.

https://www.cannabranders.com/

About Massachusetts Patient Advocacy Alliance

The Massachusetts Patient Advocacy Alliance (MPAA) is a coalition of medical marijuana patients, their family members and caregivers, medical professionals, and public health groups that supports safe access to medical cannabis for patients with a doctor’s recommendation.

MPAA brought the 2012 medical cannabis ballot initiative to the voters, and has since been working to ensure implementation of the law is completed in a manner that works for individual patients and communities as a whole.

http://www.compassionforpatients.com/ 

Think Patient Night Might Benefit Your City or Town?

We plan on having Patient Night once a month in various locations around Massachusetts. If you're interested in sponsoring this event or supporting future Patient Night events in different locations around the state, please email Nichole Snow at [masked]. 


Legal Disclaimer  

Views or opinions expressed by speakers or sponsors at our local Cannabis Society community events do not necessarily express the opinion or views of the Cannabis Society organization and we do not take responsibility for the views expressed or the actions of speakers or sponsors at our local events. The Cannabis Society does not distribute cannabis.

The Cannabis Society is Growing

Our group has grown by leaps and bounds these past few years and we are proud to announce that the Cannabis Society is going to continue to grow and develop our ecosystem with groundbreaking events centering around medical cannabis, technology, art, and science. We couldn’t do it without our members and we want to thank you for being apart of this growing organization.
results.name: Cannabis as a Preventative Medicine

results.description:
“Great photography is about depth of feeling, not depth of field.”
– Peter Adams


Greetings Photographers! Time to get out there again and practice, practice, practice.   I thought we should do something really fun this weekend that will challenge your skills in a different way. We will focus on candid portraits.

Photo by workshop participant Jeff. Beautiful natural lighting and connection to the subject. 

Photographing people, strangers, friends, family, is a skill we should all strive to develop. It is a wonderful part of being a photographer, to be able to capture moment of beauty as people enjoy the simple pleasures of life. I hope you will join us to hone your skill and have some fun. 


Beautiful character shot during Rockport workshop by Hilary using natural light, and the color blue. What a wonderful expression she captured here!


Some of the topics I will cover in the workshop will be:

• Timing and positioning so you increase the chances of getting the lucky shot.

• Composition of subjects within the frame and in relationship to each other.

• How to use elements of color, light, texture, and motion to evoke emotion and tell a story. 

• How to simplify the shot so you capture the essence of the moment.

• Some basic camera operation tips will be offered if you need them to freeze the action and catch the moment.

How to get permission for the photo with out destroying the candid feeling. 

If you have taken this class with me recently, I will have some new challenges for you so you can continue to improve. You will be working with both aperture and shutter priority if you recently took the technical skills workshop with me.

This special workshop on street photography will introduce you to a step by step method for gaining confidence in photographing people. This is a essential skill for travel photographers, family photographers, and anyone interested in capturing the ordinary moments of life in a way that tells a story.

Photo By Student at previous Street Photography Class. Great interactions. 

Photo By Instructor: Suzanne Merritt Creative composition using fresh viewpoint. There are many ways to photograph people without being intrusive. We will get creative about different ways to approach the assignments.

We will start at Quincy Market where there are plenty of people to practice on.  People will be busy shopping, eating, and watching street performers so they will never notice you are photographing them for your class assignments.

Then we will move on to the new Boston Public Market for a fresh challenge with different lighting and background challenges. Time and weather permitting there will be a third location challenge in the area.

Great example of selecting a small detail to tell a story. Shallow depth of field blurs out the background to bring our full attention to the subject.  And beautiful negative spaces pull it all together. Photo by Student Doc.

How we will work:

We will meet together in front of the Faneuil Hall building at Quincy Market where I will give a short introduction to the topics and show you sample photos. 

You will be given specific photo assignments designed to build your skills step by step. I will provide handout cards so you can practice the assignments again after the class.

At the end class there will be social time where we will take a look at the photos of the day and give each other constructive critique. I highly recommend you plan on joining us for this part of the workshop. We also critique our work after class on our group site so you can post 5 photos from class and get feedback. This is a highly valued aspect of our group. 

Wonderful eye contact and interaction with the subject. Student Heather C.

Please RSVP right away to hold your spot in this class. The tuition for the workshop is $45.00 I look forward to seeing you on Saturday. Also please hold the same time on Sunday should we need to change the date due to weather this time of year, you never know. If you can't make it on the "rain date" I will refund your tuition. 

P.S. This class is appropriate for all levels so if you have just joined the group, this would be a perfect place to start. You can leave your camera on Auto if the is where you are at the moment. You do need a camera rather than an iPhone for this one but not a tripod. You will meet like minded people who love photography and you will learn some new skills at the same time. What a great way to spend the afternoon!

Until we meetup again,

Suzanne

Cacao, otherwise known as raw chocolate, is a powerful plant medicine for the heart both physically and emotionally. Cacao is perfect for deep personal healing as well as  purely having a fun energetic afternoon. The music will be lead by Gregorio, a sound healer who works with many different styles of music. Bring any percussion instruments and drums that you have, and make sure to eat a filling meal before and after the ceremony. Snacks will also be available. Cacao will be served as a drink upon entering and music will begin shortly after. Come feel the love that delicious cacao brings to the body, heart and soul!

results.description:
Cradles to Crayons, formally launched in Boston in 2002, provides children from birth through age 12, living in homeless or low-income situations, with the essential items they need to thrive - at home, at school and at play. These items are supplied to families free of charge by engaging and connecting communities that have with communities that need.

We will be assisting in the processing and packaging of donations. The tasks are interactive and may include sorting clothes and shoes, preparing bags, and testing toys. 


All volunteers must arrive 10-15 minutes in advance and also pre-register via the following link:
http://www.cradlestocrayons.org/node/add/registration/a0RC000000Gohkr


I've secured 10 spots so far, but I can request more spots if more people show interest.


Check out the Cradles to Crayons official website for additional information and FAQs about volunteering: http://www.cradlestocrayons.org/


Looking forward to seeing everyone there!
results.name: Cradles to Crayons

results.description:
We're doing a fun 10-week training program! All levels are welcome, and you don't need to be able to make it every week. In week 1, we timed ourselves in a few key events (e.g. 100 freestyle), and now we're doing a training program to get ourselves faster. At the end of 10 weeks we'll time ourselves again and see how much we've improved! If you can't make a week, don't worry, you can still come to the other weeks.


The 10 weeks will include clinics on technique, flip turns, and any special requests, as well as some good sets to get us swimming faster. If there's a race you're targeting and want to work on that distance or event, let us know and we can help tailor the workouts for you.

We go across the street for pizza (or other food if you don't eat pizza) every week after the swim. Save time to join us! We usually finish up by about 4:30pm.


---------------


The pool opens at 2pm, so we meet to go in at 1:45 so that we can be out on the pool deck by 2. $6 to get in, Cambridge residents $5 (or you can buy a 10-pack for an approximate 10% discount, and we do these weekly so you'll have the opportunity to use them up).

Street parking is available but stressful, and the 69 bus drops off down the block, or you can bike or run there and do 2/3 of a triathlon :)
results.name: Saturday swimming - 10 week training program - Week 2 - Technique clinic

results.description:
Winter is here and the nights are long, which is all the more reason to get outside. Come and join us as we explore the Arnold Arboretum and get to know the many varieties of medicinal tree species growing in Boston.

This time of year, other medicinal plants have passed by and are waiting for the spring to come. Medicinal trees may have lost their leaves, however there are barks and evergreen needles that can still be harvested and made into teas, syrups, tinctures, salves and lotions. Pine, oak, birch, and many, many more species will be discussed, as well as their different preparations and medicinal virtues.

We will be meeting in front of the Hunnewell Visitor’s Center near the main entrance to the Arnold Arboretum, located at 125 the Arborway in Jamaica Plain. A map of our meeting point can be found here:
https://www.google.com/maps?ll=42.304961,-71.121891&z=14&t=m&hl=en&gl=US&mapclient=embed&q=125+Arborway+Boston,+MA+02130

In case of heavy rain, the walk will be rescheduled. If there is light rain or flurries of snow, we will still meet and walk!

The fee for this class is $10. Please rsvp by emailing [masked], or by calling (857) 615-7763.

Saturday, January 23rd, 2016
2:00 – 3:30 pm
By the Hunnewell Visitor’s Center
Arnold Arboretum, Boston
results.name: Medicinal Tree Identification Walk

Hi.

I'm not dead, and neither is this group. Sorry for the long delay in meet-ups (again). Suffice to say that 2015 was a scheduling nightmare. I really am sorry we didn't get together more often.

Let's change that. Yeah?

Join me at Redbones, in Davis Sq. for a little post-brunch, pre-snow whiskey fest. We'll enjoy the vast bourbon and malts list, perhaps some comfort food (if you're so inclined), and get a nice social boost in our systems before we all hunker down for the storm later that night.

And hey, you can all give me a bunch of crap for dropping off the face of the earth (again)!

See you Saturday, whiskey-fans!

results.description:
I am going to offer a short series of classes that will cover some basic knife skills. I will discuss how to care for your knives, what kind of knives to use for a task and how to decide what kind of knives to buy. I will cover developing a flavor profile, cover some recipes, and discuss cooking methods. 

This first class will cover information that will help you shorten your prep time when cooking and help reduce the clutter in your kitchen gadget drawer. We will cover how to cut vegetables impact flavor profiles, texture and aesthetics. We will discuss how to prioritize tasks when you are getting ready to cook and also how to multitask more effectively.

 Each participant will leave with a package of goodies. We will prepare ingredients so that we can have a simple meal together at the end of class. All equipment and material will be provided. The classes will be small so there will be lots of time for individual attention.

Tuition: The classes can be purchased individually or you can attend all three. Here is how it breaks down. 

 
One Class: $80
Two Classes: $150
Three Classes: $210

results.description:
We traditionally have a large social meetup twice each month. This gives everyone an opportunity to come and make new friends, practice their Japanese or English, and spend time with a bunch of interesting people from around the Boston area and overseas.  This meetup may be cancelled if there are very few RSVPs.

Close to Boylston on the Green Line, or Chinatown on the Orange Line.
Also a short walk from Park Street or Downtown Crossing. 

• From Boylston Station, go south on Tremont Street (away from Boston Common),  then take a right onto Stuart Street.  The food court will be on your right; you enter the building right by the Dunkin Donuts.

• From Chinatown Station, go west on Boylston Street (toward Boston Common), then take a left onto Tremont Street. Turn right onto Stuart Street. The food court will be on your right; you enter the building right by the Dunkin Donuts.

There is a map of the area below. If you have trouble finding us, please feel free to call or text me at[masked]-2923.  Also you can call if you come after we have left for Chinatown, although then there is a greater chance I will miss the call.

Come on by, relax, practice in either language of your choice, and enjoy being part of our growing community!

The Meetup does not end at 6 - instead, some time around there, we usually go out to Chinatown for dinner afterwards to eat family style - anyone who wants to come is welcome. The cost is usually around $12-20/person (not including any drinks for which people pay their own way).  We are open to restaurant suggestions.  However, I am not willing to get into dividing up large numbers of orders on one giant check, which is why we generally go to Chinatown and split everything down the middle.  If you don't want to eat at all, you can come and just enjoy the company for free.

Stuart Street view
results.how_to_find_us: We usually have several tables pulled together at the highest point of the food court nearest the elevator.

results.description:
Thunder Girls Night Before Christmas


'Twas the night before Christmas; us girls and our bikes,

Thought we'd take a quick spin, to see the Christmas lights.

So we bundled up warmly, to ward off the cold,

And revved up our engines and onward we rolled.


I on my Harley, in my leathers all black,

Had just set out riding, just me, and the pack,

With the other behind me, we rode staggered file,

On the near empty highway for less than a mile,


 When up from behind us, there came such a racket,

It was a fat guy, on a Fireblade, in a red leather jacket;

His lid was red too, trimmed with a white flash,

A fat guy on that machine - he cut quite a dash.


There, to our amazement, was old Santa Biker,

He pulled up alongside, and then wheelied right by us,

He had saddlebags crammed full of the goodies we love,

Like big buckled boots, and black gauntlet gloves.


 He didn't have reindeer, or helpers, like elves,

Santa Biker rode solo, delivering all by himself.

He rode like a madman, with presents galore,

Strapped down with elastics, bungees, tank bag and more.


 From out of his helmet, Santa's voice rolled,

Across the night air, so crisp and so cold.

"On Ducati, on Suzuki, Yamaha and Kawasaki,

No one would get presents, if I rode on a Harley."


 He had lights on his helmet, a dark tinted visor,

Grabbed a fist full of brake and stopped right beside us,

He lifted his visor, looked us straight in the eyes,

"Have you all been good bikers? Do you want a surprise?"


 He opened a saddlebag, his eyes twinkled with glee,

As he withdrew a neat parcel and then gave it to me,

The thing that I wished for, and wanted all year,

A new set of gauntlets, essential biker gear!


 I stood there in shock, I could not believe this,

I gave him a bear hug, and okay, a quick kiss,

He gave me a wink, his eyes full of good cheer,

Then peeled out and wheelied, one fist in the air.


 But as he rode off, and headed out of sight,

The Fireblade looking about to take flight,

I heard him exclaim, as he sped into the night,

"Merry Christmas to all, stay safe and upright!"

****************************************************************************

results.description:
ADVANCED TICKETS.  FILM BEGINS AT 4:10

The winner of the Silver Bear for Best Actress (Charlotte Rampling, Under the Sand, Stardust Memories) and Best Actor (Tom Courtenay, Dr. Zhivago, The Dresser) at the Berlin International Film Festival, 45 Years is a moving and profound look at marriage and the secrets we keep. There is just one week until Kate Mercer’s (Rampling) 45th wedding anniversary and the planning for the party is going well. But then a letter arrives for her husband (Courtenay). The body of his first love has been discovered, frozen and preserved in the icy glaciers of the Swiss Alps. Kate and Geoff’s marriage is shaken by the discovery, which calls into question the life they’ve built together. By the time the party is upon them, five days later, there may not be a marriage left to celebrate. 45 Years is a new take on relationships, old age, forgiveness and jealousy, from acclaimed director and co-writer Andrew Haigh (Weekend, HBO’s “Looking”).


"The devastating 45 Years is as much a ghost story as a marriage drama" - AV CLUB

See you at the movie,

John
